alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 8:45AM MST until January 07 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Extended period of bitter cold, periods of snow with blowing snow and dangerous wind chills. * WHERE...South central and southeast Montana, as well as the Sheridan Foothills in Wyoming. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Snow and blowing snow will continue moving through the area this morning with accumulations of a trace to 2 inches. Plan on slippery road conditions. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The major change will occur today with light snow falling as temperatures fall 20 degrees or more through the day. Wednesday will be the coldest day with high temperatures below zero and lows 15 to 30 degrees below. Another round of snow will develop Thursday, with significant accumulations possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
